Title.evidence: A Randomised Controlled Trial Comparing Mini-Subvastus and Standard Medial Parapatellar Approaches in Total Knee Arthroplasty

Trial_Design.evidence: The unit of randomisation was the individual patient, with a sample size determined to detect clinically meaningful differences.

Participants.evidence: This randomised controlled trial involved 40 patients undergoing TKA, randomised to either a mini-subvastus or standard medial parapatellar approach.

Intervention.evidence: randomised to either a mini-subvastus or standard medial parapatellar approach.

Method_Outcome.evidence: Participants were evaluated preoperatively and 2 months postoperatively.

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Randomisation was computer-generated, and allocation was concealed.

Blinding.evidence: Outcome assessors were blinded, but patients and clinicians were not.

Number_Randomised.evidence: This randomised controlled trial involved 40 patients undergoing TKA.

Result_Outcome.evidence: No significant differences were found between groups in KSS, SF-12, KOOS, UCLA activity, patient milestone diary, isometric strength, or gait parameters, except for a marginally higher stair ascent speed in the MIS group.
